title: Yasuo Pre-Season 6, Desperate need of a nerf somewhere.
body: So with the Pre-Season underway, I have had the immense displeasure of facing off against a few Yasuo's as I have had teammates that refused to ban him. My displeasure is this; Before 15 minutes Yasuo has 100% crit chance with only a Static Shiv and a Cloak of Agility, and then there is the fun little thing about how he has 97% Armor Penetration after he ults if he has the maseries and a Last Whisper(or upgraded version). Now I understand that sometimes things slip through during the Pre-Season changes, but I seriously fail to see how somebody did not notice these very impactful issues. How do you deal with a Yasuo that has 100% crit and can basically deal True damage???? Anyone have any thoughts on this?

replies.body:
Was Riot aware that crit-using melee carries would be outliers before they shipped the patch?  Yes, they were.

In order to properly balance them, Riot needed to see how unbalanced they were and where they need power-gating.  PBE can give vague ideas, but Live provides the best data.
Another problem at the moment is that Warlord's Bloodlust is insanely overpowered, so it's hard to gauge how much Yasuo is the problem versus the mastery.  True data for nerfing Yasuo, if such a nerf is necessary (though it will likely be needed), will only be collected after the hotfix.

This is BULL SHIT, as they nerfed ashes passive KNOWING it would be broken with bloodlust, but left EVERY SINGLE OTHER early game crit champion alone.. Complete BULL SHIT.

If this is the case then why did they nerf ashe but left {{champion:51}} {{champion:21}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:157}}  alone?

They addressed this somewhere on the boards, but the gist of is that they **knew** ash would be a problem, and that she would be overbearing, but were only pretty sure that Yasuo and Tryn would be issues and didn't know how problematic they'd be.

They also mentioned thinking that Vlad and Rumble would be too strong after the AP item updates but were surprised to see that their performance dropped.

When you're not completely sure, you send your changes live, watch the data pour in, and hotfix as necessary. Which is what they're doing.

> They also mentioned thinking that Vlad and Rumble would be too strong after the AP item updates but were surprised to see that their performance dropped.

yes thos AP nerfs guna make them to strong lmfao.....RIOT makes me so sad.
The AP item overhaul from a while back, not what we're currently looking at. The one that gave us a several 100 AP and 80 AP items instead of 120s and 60s.
aaah, gotcha. RIOT still makes me sad

More ADCs than just Ashe, Cait, and MF build crit with their first item.

A pedantic nature aside, I would propose that the people at Riot probably underestimated how strong the mastery was and how much Trynd and Yasuo could abuse it.  Ashe was definitely much more obvious.

It was an unfortunate mistake.  I think people forget that the devs play their own game, so they probably are as unhappy with an unbalanced product as, well, everyone else.
Ashe cait and MF crit with 00000000 items..... please learn and know your champions.

I had forgotten Double Up counted as a crit on the second target if the first target died.  My bad.
Headshot, however, is simply an on-hit effect.  It does not count as a crit.

Also, please, remember to be civil.  Insults are not helpful in achieving a climate wherein both parties can share their thoughts and learn from each other.
She had 100% crit rate at lvl 1 before.  She's also ranged so it would be much Easyer for her to farm back up.

honestly its not the mastery on yas thats the problem its that he has way too much power far too early. even if all you have is a cloak of agility and a brawlers glove you still have 60-62% crit chance. That's only the cost of a Zeal atm.

Warlord's Bloodlust is actually a massive component of Yasuo's overwhelming power.  He acquires massive sustain without building any lifesteal.  So, at a SS and an IE, this mastery basically gives Yasuo 50%+ of a lifesteal item.

With just a Zeal, Yasuo has a reliable way to heal off of minion waves.  This means that he can force a trade, and heal off the damage he took.

Does Yasuo synergize with the item changes too much?  Probably/definitely.  However, it's hard to say how much while Warlord's Bloodlust exists.

I do not disagree that Yasuo probably taps into too much power too soon; however, I believe you underestimate the impact of the mastery.
